options.description: The dependency groups to ignore. (multiple values allowed)
options.name: --without

options.description: The optional dependency groups to include. (multiple values allowed)
options.name: --with

options.description: The only dependency groups to include. (multiple values allowed)
options.name: --only

options.description: Synchronize the environment with the locked packages and the specified groups. (Deprecated)
options.name: --sync

options.description: Do not install the root package (the current project).
options.name: --no-root

options.description: Do not install any directory path dependencies; useful to install dependencies without source code, e.g. for caching of Docker layers)
options.name: --no-directory

options.description: Output the operations but do not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
options.name: --dry-run

options.description: Extra sets of dependencies to install. (multiple values allowed)
options.name: --extras

options.description: Install all extra dependencies.
options.name: --all-extras

options.description: Install dependencies from all groups.
options.name: --all-groups

options.description: Exclude all dependencies.
options.name: --only-root

options.description: Compile Python source files to bytecode.
options.name: --compile

options.description: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command.
options.name: --help

options.description: Do not output any message.
options.name: --quiet

options.description: Display this application version.
options.name: --version

options.description: Force ANSI output.
options.name: --ansi

options.description: Disable ANSI output.
options.name: --no-ansi

options.description: Do not ask any interactive question.
options.name: --no-interaction

options.description: Disables plugins.
options.name: --no-plugins

options.description: Disables Poetry source caches.
options.name: --no-cache

options.description: Specify another path as the project root. All command-line arguments will be resolved relative to the current working directory.
options.name: --project

options.description: The working directory for the Poetry command (defaults to the current working directory). All command-line arguments will be resolved relative to the given directory.
options.name: --directory

options.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
options.name: --verbose
